channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How 3 Nobel Prize Winners Are Shaping Quantum Physics
item.description: Three scientists at U.S. universities won the Nobel Prize in physics for advancing quantum technology. Here’s why their work matters.

item.title: Studio Ghibli: It’s good for your health, a new study shows
item.description: As any Studio Ghibli fan will testify, an afternoon spent binging Hayao Miyazaki classics is guaranteed to leave a warm, fuzzy feeling inside. Now, th...

item.title: Billionaire PC tycoon Michael Dell is riding the AI gold rush—and he says the party’s far from over even if eventually ‘there’ll be too many’ data centers
item.description: Dell Technologies’ stock is up 39% year-to-date.

item.title: Polymarket Just Got a $2 Billion Investment From the NYSE. But Its Future Is Far From Clear
item.description: The investment makes founder Shayne Coplan the youngest self-made billionaire in history as the site prepares its U.S. comeback

item.title: Tesla Just Made 2 Surprising Announcements to Win Back Fleeing Customers
item.description: Can Tesla’s strategy of releasing cheaper versions of its existing vehicles help the brand stay competitive?

item.title: AI has this harmful belief about women
item.description: A new study out Wednesday in the journal Nature from the University of California, Berkeley found that women are systematically presented as younger t...

item.title: IRS to furlough almost half its workforce under contingency plan for government shutdown
item.description: Last week Trump said roughly 750,000 federal workers nationwide were expected to be furloughed across agencies, with some potentially fired.

item.title: 29-year-old charged with starting the fire that destroyed LA’s Pacific Palisades
item.description: The complaint said the suspect, Jonathan Rinderknecht, asking a question to ChatGPT about lighting a cigarette in an effort to cover his tracks.

item.title: Tesla took its shot—and missed
item.description: Too late. Too expensive. Too bland. Too antiquated. Too much of the same. There are just too many toos when it comes to Tesla’s new “cheap” cars, whic...

item.title: CBS becomes Bari Weiss’ ‘anti-woke’ arena as the millennial media mogul (and mainstream media critic) digs in
item.description: The network where Walter Cronkite and Dan Rather became news icons is under new management.

item.title: What happens when online plane enthusiasts meet up IRL?
item.description: On a recent Saturday, several hundred people flocked to Los Angeles International Airport and spent most of the day looking at airplanes — all because...

item.title: Some Ford employees say they’ve been warned they could be fired for not going back to the office, report says
item.description: The automaker has tightened its return-to-office policy, requiring most salaried staff to work on-site four days a week as part of CEO Jim Farley’s br...

item.title: American Airlines has quietly changed its bag-check policy. If you travel with large luggage, plan accordingly
item.description: If you’re a frequent flier, chances are you’ve been seized by the fear that your carry-on bag is too big for the overhead compartments. Now, for Ameri...

item.title: MacKenzie Scott Just Donated $42 Million to This Education Nonprofit
item.description: Scott made a large gift to this Bay Area organization that provides college scholarships to low-income students.

item.title: Why Gold and Bitcoin Are Breaking Records
item.description: The debasement trade is fueling a boom in hard assets.

item.title: Dow ends flat, S&P 500 and Nasdaq close at records after release of Fed minutes
Dow trims gains, S&P and Nasdaq set for records as Fed releases minutes — live
The Fed minutes are out. ‘Most’ officials backed lower interest rates this year.
